questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the NG Setup procedure?

answers.a: To send user data packets through the N3 interface
answers.b: To establish the control plane connection between gNB and AMF
answers.c: To assign TEIDs for data tunnels

explanations.a: Incorrect — N3 handles user-plane, not NG Setup.
explanations.b: Correct — NG Setup initializes the control-plane link between gNB and AMF using NGAP.
explanations.c: Incorrect — TEIDs are assigned during PDU session setup.
explanations.d: Incorrect — UPF activation is unrelated to NG Setup.

questions.question: Which protocol is used in the NG-C interface?

explanations.a: Incorrect — GTP-U is for user-plane on N3.
explanations.b: Correct — NGAP is the control-plane protocol used on NG-C between gNB and AMF.
explanations.c: Incorrect — HTTP is not used for NG-C.
explanations.d: Incorrect — FTP has no role in 5G signaling.

questions.question: NG Setup signaling runs over which transport protocol?

explanations.a: Incorrect — TCP is not used in NGAP.
explanations.b: Correct — NGAP runs over SCTP to ensure reliable signaling.
explanations.c: Incorrect — UDP is used for GTP-U, not control signaling.

questions.question: The N3 interface connects the gNB to which core network function?

explanations.c: Correct — N3 carries user-plane traffic between gNB and UPF.

questions.question: What protocol is used for user plane data transport over the N3 interface?

explanations.b: Correct — GTP-U carries user-plane packets on N3.
explanations.c: Incorrect — SCTP is a transport for NGAP.
explanations.d: Incorrect — RLC is part of the RAN protocol stack.

questions.question: Which of the following identifies the PDU session in 5G?

explanations.b: Incorrect — TEID identifies tunnels, not sessions.
explanations.c: Correct — Each PDU session has a unique PDU Session ID.

questions.question: In GTP-U, what does TEID stand for?

explanations.a: Correct — TEID identifies each GTP-U tunnel endpoint.
explanations.b: Incorrect — Not used in GTP terminology.
explanations.d: Incorrect — TEID does not relate to encryption.

questions.question: What is a common port number used by GTP-U?

explanations.d: Incorrect — 110 is used for POP3 email.

questions.question: The AMF is responsible for which type of plane?

explanations.a: Incorrect — UPF manages the user plane.
explanations.b: Correct — AMF handles signaling, mobility, and registration.
explanations.c: Incorrect — Applications are outside 5G Core functions.
explanations.d: Incorrect — RLC is part of the RAN.

questions.question: What is the main element exchanged in the NG Setup Request?

explanations.b: Incorrect — AMF Name is in the Response.
explanations.c: Correct — gNB sends its Global RAN Node ID to identify itself.
explanations.d: Incorrect — QoS flows appear during PDU session setup.

questions.question: Which component assigns the UL TEID during PDU session setup?

explanations.a: Incorrect — AMF does not assign TEIDs.
explanations.b: Incorrect — SMF instructs UPF but does not generate TEIDs.
explanations.c: Correct — UPF provides the UL TEID for uplink GTP-U tunneling.
explanations.d: Incorrect — gNB uses TEIDs but does not allocate them.

questions.question: The default paging DRX value in NG Setup is used for:

explanations.a: Incorrect — DRX has no relation to slicing.
explanations.b: Correct — DRX defines how often the UE wakes to check paging messages.
explanations.c: Incorrect — TEIDs are unrelated to DRX.
explanations.d: Incorrect — GUAMI identifies AMF, not DRX.

questions.question: The NG Setup Response contains which of the following?

explanations.a: Incorrect — That is sent by the gNB in the Request.
explanations.b: Incorrect — TEIDs appear during PDU session setup.
explanations.c: Correct — The AMF provides its AMF Name in the NG Setup Response.
explanations.d: Incorrect — PDU Session ID is unrelated to NG Setup.

questions.question: The NG-C interface typically uses which port number?

explanations.d: Correct — SCTP over port 38412 is used for NGAP on NG-C.

questions.question: What is the sequence after NG Setup and UE registration to enable user data flow?

explanations.a: Incorrect — NG Reset is used for clearing state.
explanations.b: Correct — After registration, PDU Session Setup is required to establish N3 tunnels for data flow.
explanations.c: Incorrect — NGAP Update is not part of data activation flow.
explanations.d: Incorrect — AMF authentication happens before registration completes.
